title.rendered: Apply for UK Government GREAT Scholarships at University of Manchester 2024

content.rendered:
The University of Manchester is delighted to invite highly qualified international students to apply for the UK Government GREAT Scholarships 2024. These scholarships are designed for exceptional students who have demonstrated outstanding academic achievements and are seeking to pursue a degree program at the University.

Contents on This Page

Toggle
  • UK Government GREAT Scholarships Overview
    • UK Government GREAT Scholarships 2024 
    •  Eligibility Criteria
    • Application Procedures

The GREAT Scholarships 2024 are a collaborative initiative between The University of Manchester, the UK government’s GREAT Britain campaign, and the British Council. These scholarships provide financial support of up to £10,000 to contribute towards tuition fees for one-year master’s programs in specific subject areas. The scholarships are specifically open to students from India and Nigeria, who are planning to enroll in the academic year 2024/24.

UK Government GREAT Scholarships Overview

Scholarship Sponsor(s): UK Government/University of Manchester, UK

Host Institution(s): University of Manchester

Scholarship Worth: $10,000

Number of Awards: Several

Application Deadline: June 01, 2024

Study Level: Masters

Nationality: International Student

UK Government GREAT Scholarships 2024 

GREAT scholarships are jointly funded by The University of Manchester with the UK government’s GREAT Britain campaign and the British Council. The scholarship is available for any master’s in the School of Natural Sciences or School of Engineering, School of Law and School of Arts, Languages and Cultures.

 Eligibility Criteria

To be eligible for UK Government GREAT Scholarships for International Students, applicants are expected to meet the following conditions:

  • Scholarships can only be awarded to offer holders who are passport holders of
    Bangladesh, Kenya, Mexico, Nigeria, Pakistan, Thailand and Turkey;
  • If a course/programme lasts longer than one year, the scholarships will be offered
    for the first year of study only;
  • Scholarships will be offered at postgraduate taught (Master’s) level only;
  • Scholarships will be offered for the study of full-time, on-campus postgraduate taught (MA, MSc) programmes only;
  • Scholarships can only be awarded to applicants who are classified by the University
    as an international tuition fee payer;
  • As a condition of the award of a scholarship, recipients are required to take part in
    student ambassador and/or mentoring schemes;

Application Procedures

How-to-Apply: To be considered for the Award of British Council GREAT Scholarship in partnership with The University of Manchester, You must complete a GREAT scholarship application form before deadline. This will be emailed to all relevant offer-holders by the International Office.

Successful applicants will be notified by 16 June 2024. Explore the relevant country profiles for further guidance with regards to scholarship opportunities for your country.

Visit the Official Website for Further Details
